text: Downregulation of Wilms ' tumor gene ( <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is not a prerequisite for erythroid or megakaryocytic differentiation of the leukemic cell line K562 .
The Wilms ' tumor gene ( <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) encodes a transcription factor of the zinc finger type .

A high expression of <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been detected in a range of acute leukemias , and <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is downregulated during induced differentiation of some leukemic cell lines .

text: Overexpression of <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in some myeloid cell lines confers resistance to differentiation induction .

text: These observations suggest that a high <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in hematopoietic cells is incompatible with differentiation .

text: K562 cells express endogenous <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which is downregulated as a response to induced differentiation along the erythroid and megakaryocytic pathways .

text: We now demonstrate that a forced exogenous expression of the four different isoforms of <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in K562 does not affect the differentiation response , as judged by accumulation of hemoglobin in response to hemin or the expression of megakaryocytic cell surface markers in response to 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( TPA ) .

text: We conclude that downregulation of <extra_id_0> WT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> during induced differentiation of K562 cells is not a prerequisite for erythroid or megakaryocytic differentiation of these cells .
